arm_group.description: The intervention group will perform a 12 week pulmonary rehabilitation program consisting of 30 minutes of treadmill aerobic exercise training  and 30 minutes of muscle strength training.

brief_summary.textblock:
Lymphangioleiomyomatosis (LAM) is a rare disease in which reduced exercise capacity is
      frequently present. The mechanisms applied are airflow obstruction, abnormal diffusion
      capacity and dynamic hyperinflation (DH).

      Pulmonary rehabilitation (PR) has proved benefit in improving exercise tolerance, dyspnea,
      and quality of life in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. There are no studies
      evaluating the impact of PR in patients with LAM.

      The hypothesis under study is that PR determine improvement in exercise capacity, dyspnea,
      quality of life, muscle force, functional limitation and DH in these patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of lymphangioleiomyomatosis established by tissue biopsy and / or a
             combination of history and high-resolution computed tomography scanning

          -  Clinical stability, defined as no exacerbations or hospitalizations related to the
             underlying disease for a minimum of 6 weeks and no change in the treatment regimen in
             the last 3 months

          -  Low level of physical activity, defined as patients who walk less than 10 thousand
             daily steps and / or are not performing regular physical activity for at least 4
             months before the start of rehabilitation

          -  Signature of the free, prior and informed consent for participation in the study

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Lung transplant recipients

          -  Musculoskeletal disorders that would prevent the patient from performing  exercise
             training

          -  Severe (NYHA IV) or uncontrolled heart disease

facility.name: Pulmonary Division, Heart Institute (InCor), University of Sao Paulo Medical School

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Impact of a Pulmonary Rehabilitation Program on Exercise Capacity in Patients With Lymphangioleiomyomatosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak oxygen consumption (VO2 peak) during constant work rate cycle ergometry
Dynamic hyperinflation and  ventilatory parameters during constant work rate cycle ergometry
Dyspnea and fatigue in the lower limbs during constant work rate cycle ergometry

secondary_outcome.description: The Modified Medical Research Council Dyspnea Scale (mMRC) and  Baseline Dyspnea Index (BDI) will be evaluated pre - and post - intervention
secondary_outcome.measure: Dyspnea and functional disability related to daily life activities

secondary_outcome.description: St. George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ)  pre - and post - intervention
secondary_outcome.measure: Health factors related to quality of life

secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) performed pre - and post - intervention
Evaluated using a pedometer for one week pre - and post - intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in six minute walking distance and in desaturation - distance ratio (DDR)

secondary_outcome.description: Using one repetition maximum (1 RM) pre - and post - intervention
